title: Rachael Bletchly: Coleen and Becky's Wagatha Christie saga is a troll's paradise
text:

The Brexit doomsday clock is ticking, eco warriors are out ­heralding the apocalypse and Donald Trump has unleashed the dogs of war on Syria.

But on Wednesday a story hitting 6.5 on the scandal scale sparked a social media tsunami. And in my office people gasped audibly as the shock news hit their screens.

Coleen Rooney, wife of Wayne, had turned Wagatha Christie – setting a Mousetrap to catch an Instagram sneak ratting on her to a national newspaper.

She blocked ­everyone from the account ­except her prime suspect before dangling juicy titbits about her family and career.

(Image: Aaron Parfitt / SplashNews.com)

When a fake story about her leaky basement was published, Coleen had her culprit.

And, in a dramatic reveal worthy of Poirot, she took to Twitter and her 1.3 million followers to out –drum roll please – fellow Wag Becky Vardy as the snitch.

Furious Becky, married to Jamie Vardy, denied it totally, suggesting her own Instagram was hacked.

But this bizarre Roodunnit has held the entire nation in rapt ­fascination ever since.

It’s Footballers Wives crossed with Miss Marple.

(Image: Aaron Parfitt / SplashNews.com)

Sparkling Cyanide mixed with poisoned prosecco. Such a laugh, eh? A pair of celeb soccer wives getting their acrylic nails into each other. All harmless fun. Or is it?

Because Becky Vardy – innocent until proven guilty – is heavily ­pregnant with her fifth child and now ­being trolled viciously by Team Coleen supporters.

On Friday the Vardys had to call in cops after receiving sick death threats, while other haters have told Becky they hope her baby dies.

But, let’s face it, even the great detective Hercule Poirot would have his work cut out nailing­ internet trolls.

(Image: Getty Images)

Because it’s still too easy for the cowardly ­bullies to hide ­behind the dark cloak of ­anonymity it affords.

In another twist to this story, I actually chatted to Becky about ­online abuse two weeks ago at a charity do.

And she said: “Social media has a lot of positives but it does makes it too easy for trolls to spread their negativity.

“I’m quite thick-skinned though. Because I’ve had to learn to handle a lot of crap.”

(Image: Getty Images)

Did she really rat on Coleen or is she ­living through a Wagatha Christie-like Ordeal by Innocence.

I have absolutely no idea.

But if someone else really IS to blame then Coleen will roo the day she ever pointed her Moving Finger at Becky Vardy.

Vinnie's tears will do men a favour

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Telly host Victoria Derbyshire brought together 11 men who had all lost a son, brother, nephew or friend to knife crime.

They were on her show to talk about how hard they’d found it to grieve or explain their feelings.

But, as they sat holding photos of their lost loved ones, the emotions poured out and the men took real comfort in sharing their stories.

One said he felt “released” from the constant battle to “man up”, be strong and hold back tears for fear of upsetting the wife and kids.

It was a brilliant, timely programme before World Mental Health Day on Thursday.

But equally powerful was my colleague Halina Watts’s interview last weekend with Vinnie Jones, right.

Hardman Vinnie sobbed his heart out as he spoke about the death of his beloved wife Tanya and his crushing sense of loss.

But his eloquence and courage in showing that raw emotion will help countless other men in future – as will Victoria’s guests.

Because they proved even the toughest guys need to cry – but releasing the pain can make them stronger.
description: Coleen Rooney may have flushed out a rat - but heavily pregnant Becky Vardy is now ­being trolled viciously by her supporters
